TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit PositiveTimeSpanValidator extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorBase

Docs.summary: Provides validation of a <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan"> object. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The PositiveTimeSpanValidator is used to ensure a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object meets specific criteria. The <xref:System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator.CanValidate%2A> method determines whether the object type being validated matches the expected type. The object being validated is passed as a parameter of the <xref:System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator.Validate%2A> method. To pass validation, the object being validated must be a positive <xref:System.TimeSpan> value.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the PositiveTimeSpanValidator type.
[!CODE [System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.PositiveTimeSpanValidator#1)]

Docs.summary: Determines whether the object type can be validated.
Docs.returns: `true` if the parameter matches a <see cref="T:System.TimeSpan"> object; otherwise, `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Validate(object value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether the value of an object is valid.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The object to validate is passed as a parameter of the Validate method. To pass validation, the object being validated must be a positive <xref:System.TimeSpan> value.
